title: How to Make a Disco Ball Pineapple

steps.headline: Find a shapely, fresh pineapple with abundant green leaves.
steps.description: Wash the surface to clean, including the leaves. Leave the leaves intact; they form part of the look.

steps.headline: Let dry completely.
steps.description: You can speed up the drying process by wiping the pineapple with a paper towel or a tea towel.

steps.headline: Cut off dried pieces of the pineapple peel.
steps.description: Wherever the pineapple peel has rough pieces sticking out, snip them off with nail scissors. This will help to make a smooth enough surface for applying the disco ball pieces.

steps.headline: Stand the pineapple up on the work surface.
steps.description: Work from the top to the bottom or vice versa, whichever you find easiest.

steps.headline: Glue the first circular row of square CD pieces onto the pineapple.
steps.description: Ensure that the row is straight and neat. You'll use this row as the basis for adding the remaining rows, so it must be straight.

steps.headline: Repeat with the next row.
steps.description: Continue gluing all of the rows in place.

steps.headline: Done.
steps.description: Once dried, it can be used as a table centerpiece, a decoration or hung from the ceiling as something quite different for your next party.

text: Preparing the Pineapple Find a shapely, fresh pineapple with abundant green leaves. Wash the surface to clean, including the leaves. Leave the leaves intact; they form part of the look. Let dry completely. You can speed up the drying process by wiping the pineapple with a paper towel or a tea towel. Cut off dried pieces of the pineapple peel. Wherever the pineapple peel has rough pieces sticking out, snip them off with nail scissors. This will help to make a smooth enough surface for applying the disco ball pieces. Creating the Disco Ball Pineapple Stand the pineapple up on the work surface. Work from the top to the bottom or vice versa, whichever you find easiest. Glue the first circular row of square CD pieces onto the pineapple. Ensure that the row is straight and neat. You'll use this row as the basis for adding the remaining rows, so it must be straight. Repeat with the next row. Continue gluing all of the rows in place. Let dry.  Done. Once dried, it can be used as a table centerpiece, a decoration or hung from the ceiling as something quite different for your next party.
